message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class TicTacToe {
    private String name;
    private int[][] table = new int[][]{
        {8, 1, 6},
        {3, 5, 7},
        {4, 9, 2}
    };
    private boolean[][] takenSquare = new boolean[3][3];
    private int[][] playerTable = new int[3][3];
    private int activePlayer;
    private int row;
    private int col;

    public TicTacToe(String name) {
        this.name = name;
        this.activePlayer = 0;
    }

    public boolean isValidMove(int row, int col) {
        return (row >= 0 && row < 3 && col >= 0 && col < 3 && !takenSquare[row][col]);
    }

    public void setMove(String move) {
        StringTokenizer tokenizer = new StringTokenizer(move);
        this.row = Integer.parseInt(tokenizer.nextToken()) - 1;
        this.col = Integer.parseInt(tokenizer.nextToken()) - 1;
        if (isValidMove(row, col)) {
            takenSquare[row][col] = true;
            playerTable[row][col] = table[row][col];
        }
        activePlayer = 1 - activePlayer;
    }

    public String drawTable() {
        StringBuilder a = new StringBuilder();
        for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
            for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
                a.append(drawSquare(i, j)).append("|");
            }
            a.append("\n-----------\n");
        }
        return a.toString();
    }

    private String drawSquare(int x, int y) {
        if (takenSquare[x][y]) {
            return activePlayer == 0 ? "O" : "X";
        } else {
            return " ";
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The NullPointerException was caused by the static array 'player' in the 'tictac' class which was never initialized. In the revised code, the 'player' array has been removed and the 'takenSquare' and 'playerTable' arrays have been changed to non-static. The 'isValidMove' method has been updated to check if the row and column are within the bounds of the array and if the square has not been taken. The 'setMove' method now subtracts 1 from the row and column values to account for the zero-based indexing of arrays in Java. The 'drawTable' method has been updated to use a StringBuilder for efficiency and to correctly draw the table. The 'drawSquare' method now checks the 'takenSquare' array to determine what to draw.
